I received a reply from storm regarding the disappearance of metron online, it was temporarily pulled due to a copyright issue (no detail) that has now been resolved and will be reissued soon (couple of months maybe)

Jiri Rathousky is not the primary author of Metron. Prof. Petr Tucny showed me dozens of initial sketches from 1968-9 convincing me about his authorship. The drawings are meticulously done on transparent papers, signed and dated. I newer saw something like that in Rathousky’s inheritance. There are also many witnesses confirming the version of Mr. Tucny.  
We are working on a new, extended story to Metron and solving copyright issues. It’s going slowly, Mr. Tucny has over 80, and I’m working simultaneously on another projects, holidays, etc...

Thank you all for patience.

Frantisek Storm, [www.stormtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709012323/http:/www.stormtype.com/ "www.stormtype.com")
Thank you for enlightening us Frantisek

Any news on Metron? Will it be available online?

Thanks for any information.

I was lucky enough to get this font before it was pulled. I’m glad to learn more about why, and am also curious about the implications.

If Mr. Storm is working out copyright issues how—if at all—does this effect current users?
